channel.title: Robotics on Jasmeet Singh
channel.description: Recent content in Robotics on Jasmeet Singh

item.title: Functional Weeder
item.author: jasmeet0915@gmail.com (Jasmeet Singh)
item.description: Built a fleet of two line-following robots with custom 3D-printed pick-and-place mechanisms during the e-Yantra Robotics Competition 2021–22. Developed algorithms for grid-based path planning, mapping, fleet management, PID-based line following and manipulation in Elixir. Selected among the top 5 teams out of nearly 300.

item.title: S.T.E.W.A.R.D: Smart TErrestrial WArehouse Robot Deployment
item.author: jasmeet0915@gmail.com (Jasmeet Singh)
item.description: First prize winning project for Mitsubishi America’s Rally-To-Tally Online Hackathon. Developed an autonomous solution for their problem statement of inventory management of large industrial steel pipes using computer vision and outdoor mobile robots. Demostrated the PoC with the help of a custom simulation of Husky robot in Gazebo with InfluxDB and Grafana for integration for the data visualization

item.title: ROS Perception Pipeline
item.author: jasmeet0915@gmail.com (Jasmeet Singh)
item.description: An open source project being developed as part of A.T.O.M Robotics Lab. The project is intended to work as a one-stop solution for easily deploying perception pipelines with common applications like object detection, image segmentation, image pre processing, etc. The project follows modular plugin-based architecture much like Nav2 in concept. The project is actively used in A.T.O.M’s in-house mobile robot - MR Robot

item.title: MR (ModulaR) Robot
item.author: jasmeet0915@gmail.com (Jasmeet Singh)
item.description: Our in-house custom designed and fabricated AMR at A.T.O.M. The hardware and software design follows a modular architecture making this fitting for the multiple applications, hence the name MR (ModulaR) Robot.

item.title: Sahayak Bot
item.author: jasmeet0915@gmail.com (Jasmeet Singh)
item.description: Made during the e-yantra Robotics Competition 2020-21, Sahayak Bot was the first project that introduced me to simulation-based advanced robotics development using ROS & Gazebo. We focused on the developement of the autonomy stack of Sahayak Bot, a mobile manipulator, including navigation, SLAM, perception, manipulation & mission planning using ROS, Gazebo and Moveit!. Upon completition our implementation was selected among top 7 finalists out of almost 500 teams.

item.title: Projects
item.author: jasmeet0915@gmail.com (Jasmeet Singh)
item.description:
I absolutely love making — sometimes unmaking — things. Some are useful, others… not so much ¯\_(ツ)_/¯.

But each one is something to learn from. Be it robotics, simulations, programming, electronics, 3D printing, and much more.
